member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.Extensions.Clone(System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of an object.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.NameOf.Long(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the partial name of the object, class, type, or property omitting the entry before the dot (counting from the left).
member.returns: Name without the first (left) compound prefix.
member.remarks: If the name does not include any compound parts, it will be returned as-is.
member.param: Indicates whether to return the name in camelCase.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.NameOf.Short(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the short name of the immediate object property (same as nameof()).
member.param: Indicates whether to return the name in camelCase.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.NameOf.Skip(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a shortened name of the object, class, type, or property after removing the specified number of compound prefixes or suffixes.
member.param: Full or partial property name (can also be referenced using nameof).

Number of parts to be excluded from the result. A positive number indicates skipping from the left, a negative number indicates skipping from the right. If the skipped number is bigger than the number of parts, an empty string will be returned.
If true, parameter names will be converted to camelCase.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.NameOf.Keep(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a shortened name of the object, class, type, or property keeping the specified number of compound prefixes or suffixes.
member.param: Full or partial property name (can also be referenced using nameof).

Number of parts to be included in the result. A positive number indicates including from the left, a negative number indicates including from the right. If the kept number is bigger than the number of parts, an empty string will be returned.
If true, parameter names will be converted to camelCase.
